bow: new mom to week old boy with acid reflux husband away and my mom came to stay she tried to help but it made things worse feel so ungrateful but her help has left me more stressed and tired than was before she overreacts and oversympathises when my little one cries she pulls sad faces and says she ca stand to see him in pain stares at me sadly when try to calm him down sleep deprivation is really getting to me and being mom is way harder than thought he has colic and reflux and only sleeps for just over an hour at time any help or advice or just reassurance that things will get easier removed so sorry your mom is helping had very similar experience with my son and my own mother is she leaving soon can you ask her to honestly when you reach that stress level it becomes easier to do it yourself your way it does get easier promise just take it day by day have you tilted his mattress up slightly to keep his head elevated do you have pack and play with napper for the first weeks of my sons life he had to be tightly swaddled and in the pack and play because of the tilt the waking every hour was exactly what we had for long time you need sleep here is what did got really easy snacks could eat while holding and feeding my son had little bouncer seat could take into the bathroom with me now this sounds odd but survived baby boy now plan on at least days of this routine feed baby and eat snacks while feeding him to maximize your wake time bathe shower or use the restroom while he is awake even if he is screaming in his bouncy seat the second he is asleep lay down and sleep even if its an hour just lay down immediately plan on doing nothing but surviving for few days just get any sleep you can just to get yourself reboot am sorry you are going through this am sure you are great mom hang in there it gets easier my mom did the same exact thing and also threw in comments like poor baby unfortunately there only so much you can do my daughter is almost months now and her reflux is nearly gone it goes away when their esophageal sphincter matures but sure you know all about the reflux already my daughter doctor prescribed her ranitidine liquid zantac and it helped lot until she got to be about months then she started teething lol anyway do all you can do feed her smaller more frequent meals switched my baby to soy formula and that helped lot she had an intolerance to dairy protein make sure she sleeps on an incline mine sleeps in rocker burp her as well as you can do let her lay down for about 30 mins after she eats do your best also give her gripe water because it helped her little tummy within minutes it ll get better things will get easier the first few months are brutal especially when your little one has colic and reflux if you feel your mom being there is making things harder send her home you and your baby need to be where your energy goes if she making you stressed out more than she helping then kindly let her know hang in there just make sure you and your baby are well fed try to sleep rest when baby sleeps and just remember that things do get much better eventually they sleep through the night and you ll feel like completely different person she left about an hour ago told her she was stressing me more and she went in the kitchen and cried feel calmer now she has gone your reset sleeping with simple snacks is really good idea thanks for taking the time to respond with some helpful advice removed oh almost forgot the miracle that worked seriously 98 times out of 100 for me holding your baby with one hand under their butt and one hand grabbing their jawline gently and bouncing them in the air worked almost every time instantly tried to look up what the hold is called but could find it an old lady showed me and it saved my life lol and my doctor was super impressed when held her like that during my appointment just do it safely ranitidine was lifesaver for us as well thanks for the advice my doctor is reluctant to prescribe zantac he said it big step and because baby is gaining weight he does think need it am in the uk and doctors tend to underprescribe here have been thinking about changing his formula but just worried about making things worse had to switch doctors my original doctor said it would help and the same thing about weight gain my daughter had silent reflux did spit up but it came up and she swallowed it back down her throat was raw tell them he has silent reflux and switch doctors til you get it my new doctor said zantac was fine but the next strongest one was prilosec and said she would recommend that stronger but researched to be riskier you know what best for your baby but try that face and butt hold it is miracle like this https youtu be 5coff9iioxa yes thanks new to reddit and did know how to include pictures lol have you been speaking to your health visitor or going to the weekly fortnightly heath visitor group in your area they will be able to give you some advice and if your baby will need medicine help you with your doctor have my health visitor coming to my house tomorrow will talk to her about it then and see if she thinks ranitidine will help him gripe water and gas drops helped us ca help with the reflux any more than the other commenters as far as the colic goes got really good at tummy massages basically just making sure you re putting pressure on the tummy and moving the gas downward and when you hold the baby keep him upright always had to keep mine on my shoulder with constant pressure on the tummy try to remember that eventually this will pass mine screamed all night the first weeks all day the second six weeks woke up brand new baby at months and has been smiling since just try to survive right now thank you it easy to feel like this will never end that this is my life now need to remember that this will pass and just survive for now we took our daughter to chiropractor for her reflux and she was totally different baby after only visits she also has some food sensitivities that cleared up once we got her tested and stopped eating her triggers when was baby has terrible colic up until my mom switched from dairy based formula to soy based formula turns out allergic to casein if you try that remember that it can take while for dairy proteins to leave the system change the formula keep in mind it takes 14 days to see difference ca imagine how it would worsen anything gah my mom did this too when my kids were babies she acted like it such big deal when they cry babies cry one time one of my girls was sort of happily chewing on her fingers and she goes she trying to soothe herself poor thing looked and she was perfectly happy one of mine has health condition reflux is actually part of it so feel your pain op and constantly have to reassure my mom about her issues and in the position where am the one trying to make her feel better but like sometimes it not ok and the one who needs someone to lean on she definitely makes me feel worse about things and more stressed out yes to this feel like have spent the last days trying to soothe my son and trying to comfort my mom she makes so many announcements of doom like he is in such pain ca eat when he is so unhappy love him just as much as you do please mom just eat your food so that you can cuddle him while eat mine it does end with grandma even in the teenage years when you re dealing with their hormonal issues the grandma can find way to make it worse tried this could quite get it right will have another go when am not so tired first off congrats on the baby reflux colic baby is hard want to say it gets better though right now it hard to see our little one slept in rock play you mentioned being in the uk not sure if they have those as believe fisher price is usa brand but an elevated sleep surface we also used gripe water and liquid zantac prescription also swing worked well too as baby wojlsnonly sleep in it for awhile because it wasn flat and she loved the movement all can say is ve been there with the mom thing too my mom would try to take her from me to calm her and it really will adjust and adapt and be easier hope you re able to find some relief are you on facebook infant reflux support for gerdlings is an awesome resource they help with diet changes and medications when diet doesn help reflux all the way life saver for me *cracks knuckle* looks like my months of hell with lo is paying off finally if you baby wear then keep lo upright for at least hr after eating inclined swings can help too as for your mom you ll need to sit her down and remind her that babies will be calmer if she stays calm yeah heartburn sucks but it wo kill him or maim him it might be something that he grows out too ask her to switch her sympathy to loving care he and you will appreciate her calmly holding him upright more than either of you enjoy the panic good luck also pay attention to the type of spit he has if it looks like exorcism spewing of milk then it is an allergy which my peds mix up at first looked at the rock play you can get them here am really tempted they are more expensive here than in the us for some reason says she ca stand to see him in pain what as if you can like you enjoy this her reactions imply that you re not getting upset enough about his unhappiness but you ca get all worked up about it because your baby needs you to keep it together hoping she is doing it deliberately but of course that kind of reaction from your mom is making things worse what you need to hear from her but you re hearing here instead is that this sucks but it will get better it will be ok and you can do this my son did react to gripe water at all but it helps my daughter immensely read an article that do necessarily agree with that says it does do anything beyond taste sweet which does help calm babies down disagree it has ginger in it which helps my tummyaches why would it help an infant my husband was out of town when our daughter was about month old and we just went for lots of walks in the wrap carrier do you have carrier you can wear the baby in motion may help get the gas out and help calm baby down otherwise everyone else is on the right track it all about survival good luck am in the my week old has reflux and the dr prescribed infant gaviscon and it worked wonders ask him for that the baby may well be gaining weight but bet he is getting enough sleep also ask if it worth moving onto comfort formula that may also help good luck wonder why it was really lifesaver for us our baby girl started sleeping hour stretches think the incline movement helped also the music on there she seemed to love could possibly be worth try depending on the cost thank you your words made me cry for some reason its powerful to feel understood and equally frustrating how my mom seems to not really unferstand the difference between sympathy and empathy she seemed to get really wrapped up in emoting and groaning in sympathy for the poor baby than offering any actual support he is healthy but uncomfortable wailing and gnashing of teeth wo help him at all baby girl had to go to the hospital for an unrelated issue but the bed had rolled up blanket in shape under her butt and the bed elevated she slept so well we came home and put thick folder blanket under one side of the mattress and rolled some swaddlers in shape under the sheets so she wouldn roll around worked wonders we removed it after she started rolling thanks for the support by the way it has really helped to talk it through with other moms thanks have been touched by everyone support and understanding thanks for the advice hope your baby girl is well now she is you re almost passed the rough part lack of sleep and lack of long stretches of sleep is probably one of the hardest things ve had to do in my life ve never been so grateful for straight hours in my life when it started happening about weeks pushed for it with my son explained that he was arching his back when he spit up he was not happy spitter as they say instantly my son was better do not be shy about sending her away to run an errand or something if she not helping was always polite to helping relatives while being sleep deprived and look back and think should have just told them to get the fuck away from me if you can grab an hour of sleep while she watches him do it or if he sleeps you sleep do give fuck about the dishes laundry etc you need sleep above all else love our rock play for my lo it really helps with his gas also found this pillow for him when he laying flat and it helps with reflux and flat head which is bonus we use it in his bassinet and rock play the original head shaping memory foam pillow and bamboo pillowcase baby pillow white https www amazon com dp b01bxse9hm ref=cm sw cp api vzwdbb7wt5sj5 oh honey big hugs new motherhood is tough often lonely time and it really sucks that you re not getting the support you need from your mom so glad that you reached out here you ve got this it will get easier remember just few weeks ago but it seems like forever now\ crying on the oilet holding my baby because he would scream when would set him down and had to poop had plenty of help my husband my mom my mother\ in\ law but everyone wanted to sleep at night and was terrified of people falling asleep holding the baby felt so alone and tired and frustrated cut to week 17 he months old tomorrow\ and am again in love with my baby boy those nights are distant memory he sleeps in hour chunks in the night naps on regular schedule during the day enjoy him now so yes promise it will get better feel for ya momma really really do you got this you re stronger than you think you are you will make it through this and anything else that comes your way not saying it will be easy but you can do it and you will be better for it my midwife did take me seriously about my second having reflux until she witnessed the projectile vomiting and saw the amounts it hard but try not to back down if you want to try medication switched to aptimil reflux and she was like different baby after week so sorry ve been there and know how helpless and tired you feel you ve received lots of great advice and hope something helps look forward to my girl having her baby even though she is pregnant yet thank you ladies for helping me not to be the overbearing biatchmom tend to be you are not perfect nothing else matters as know you adore your baby have confidence you will get through this there is no greater love than my children never knew love until then their love is unconditional till they grow up enjoy this my lactation nurse was amazing she told me how common reflux was and encouraged me to try infant probiotics before did ranitidine it worked really well for us hope it helps when your world calms down mom will understand hang in there and take care of you and baby first please please please try enfamil ar formula our reflux baby did 180 when we switched he still spits up good bit but he definitely was crying as much after my son had reflux like yours not bad enough for the dr to give us prescription we had luck with this gripe water https www amazon com mommys bliss gripe ounce bottles dp b00e3y0n5g th=1 if you read the ingredients it basically antacid with some ginger some gripe waters have lot of sugar corn syrup so read the ingredients but maybe worth try it helped us lot we also have to bounce our son to sleep on yoga ball while babywearing and then transfer him to his bassinet the rock play bassinet also worked great to keep him at an incline and he slept much better in that than our flat bassinet even after elevating the head of it he never slept well there this is the advice wish had when my son was born felt so much guilt and shame to do *anything* other than hold sing talk play with the baby anytime that he was awake then spent any time he *did* spend not sleeping on me which was often running around doing chores making food or getting shower was literal nightmare was so sleep deprived grumpy and borderline crazy most babies that small do take lengthy hour naps it pretty much 30 45 min bursts of napping with lots of cluster feeding getting stuff done when baby sleeps may work when they are older but you ll only be depriving yourself right now op definitely take this advice omg my mom was the worst like this also expected all kinds of help from her because an only child and they been pressuring dh and to have baby for over years now but literally days after my son was born she decided to take last minute week cruise ugh okay then she returned and would roll into my house around 10 am ish and after about an hour she complaining because she hungry and what should we do for lunch like hell if know mom have eaten actual food in days surviving by sitting in this rocker eating cheese its and drinking as little water as possible so do have to get up to use the bathroom and in the process wake my colicky baby who will want to cluster feed for the next hours she would fret over the most unnecessary things also he just twitched in his sleep why is he doing that did you ask his doctor this is the 3rd time today he has spit up have you asked his doctor why he sometimes spits up times day how come he likes to be held so often have you asked his doctor why he likes to be held all the time then there was her constant complaining holding the baby makes me so hot sweating look touch my neck feel how much sweating he so heavy it hurts my arms why is he so heavy already like omg get the fuck out of my house eventually when she offer to come over and help just decline because it would just give me so much anxiety it been tough removed prevacid and pediatric gi visit if things stay bad ca tell you how much this helped us and improved our lives learned this the hard way my son never slept and tried everything under the sun years later have week old baby girl and its absolutely the opposite with her she sleeps ton each baby is different and us as moms just survive the best we can this sounds just like my mom and is the reason never ever tell her anything is wrong because will get that sad whine guess she thinks she is being empathetic and that is helpful regarding your little one do have experience first hand with acid reflux but if you are formula feeding talk to your ped about changing brands if you are breastfeeding cut out some things from your diet and see what helps if nothing helps there are meds for babies with chronic acid reflux and if your baby needs them that fine and it does get better at weeks you are still emotionally not yourself so its harder now than it will ever be and baby is still figuring out what the heck his body is and why it does anything so that will get better too anecdotal but we had similar issues similac alumentum formula really helped our kids reflux issues ask her to leave it was so much easier when my mom and mil weren around too much it your baby you deserve the right experience and your baby does too absolutely motherhood is the most amazing experience but from what ve found almost one year in is that it can also be strangely lonely support and encouraging other moms is everything if you have any other questions or need any other advice or anything happy to share my experience really honestly feel like those first three months were the toughest as that newborn stage sorta drags along feel free to message me or anything went through the same thing now with happy 24 week old best advice can give is to get nanny for couple hours week if possible we did hours twice week so you can catch up on sleep or do errands get out of the house was game changer for my mental health do be afraid to be honest with your mother this is very vulnerable time for you and you ca take care of your baby if you are taken care of first and yes things get so much better thank you so much you said exactly what needed to hear
